page.title: 20Claydon House
page.content: In the south eastern corner of the block lies{Claydon House,}the ancestoral home of the{Verney}family since 1620.The present house dates from the mid-eighteenth century and was given to the{National Trust}in 1956,though Sir Ralph Verney still lives in the south wing.His son farms the large estate. Sir Edmund,the first Verney to live at Claydon,is distinguishd as being the {royal standard-bearer}at Edgehill;at which battle he died. A famous visitor to the house in the 19th century was{Florence {Nightingale,}the sister-in-law of Sir Harry Verney;she was fond of the area and left her mark in many ways. {**The work on this block has been done {by the children and staff of the Allan {Shaw County Combined School,Steeple {Claydon near Buckingham.**
